subject: Re: Where is the package org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner?
msgSnippet: Found it.  Thanks.  It seems odd that this would be in the 3.3 sources since it is a function available in 3.4.  For someone looking at the sources for the
messageBody:
Found it. Thanks. It seems odd that this would be in the 3.3
sources since it is a function available in 3.4. For someone looking
at the sources for the first time, this is confusing.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, ginkgo_w <ginkgo_w@...> wrote:
>
> Please check the plugins folder of the eclipse. You should download
the
> JDT-SDK file, not just the JDT-runtime file.
>
> in the plugins folder, you may see the 3 jar files. the first part
of
> the name is "org.eclipse.jdt.junit." . There are "source" in the
names.
>
> The source is correctly in the file.
> "org.eclipse.jdt.junit.runtime.source_3.3.0.v20080603-2000.jar" , I
> think this can help you
>
> regard
> ginkgo
>
> Sam wrote:
> >
> >
> > I'm trying to write a custom JUnit test runner to be used in
Eclipse
> > (Ganymede). I have some questions about how things are working so
I
> > downloaded a huge amount of Eclipse and JUnit sources. I've found
a
> > lot of stuff, but I cannot find the classes that are in the
package
> > org.eclipse. jdt.internal. unit.runner (e.g., ITestIdentifier,
> > RemoteTestRunner) .
> >
> > Does anyone know what Eclipse .jar file these sources are in?
> >
> > -Sam
> >
> >
>
